pageContext.claim: “We have reduced illegal border crossings by over 60% since May.”
pageContext.analysis: Border crossing have declined by roughly 63 percent since May, according to data from U.S. Customs and Border Protection. Trump, however, has both argued both sides of these statistics — that a high number of apprehensions means they are catching more people crossing the border and that a low number of apprehensions has deterred people from crossing the border. It’s worth noting that southwest border apprehensions in May 2019 higher than any other month in at least the four year.
